article.para: The &bcia;s are available as OCI-compatible container images directly from registry.suse.com and can be used like any other container image. For example, using one of the general purpose containers:
Alternatively, you can use a &bcia; in Dockerfile as follows:
article.screen: FROM registry.suse.com/bci/bci-base:15.4 RUN zypper -n in python3 && \ echo "Hello Green World!" > index.html ENTRYPOINT ["/usr/bin/python3", "-m", "http.server"] EXPOSE 8000
article.para: You can then build container images using the docker build . or buildah bud . commands:
article.screen:
